intro: Himalrandia tetrasperma, commonly known as the Himalayan mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky and alpine environments. The plant features small, green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Himalrandia tetrasperma is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat.
